Articles.Content: Stranded on Moho with Bill and a cranky rover
Making sweet science on Ike

Dead after a random parachute detachment.

I may revive him later.

I leave Jebediah, Bill and Bob in a command pod a kilometer or so away from KSC because the obsession with Jeb got old REALLY quick. Plus they're prioritized for every launch while they're at base so it's annoying to constantly fight the game to keep them out of my ships.

I do the same thing, really; I don't like using any of the big 3 for important missions, it gets a bit boring when Jeb is the first Kerbal on every celestial body in the universe, he's more of a mascot that I just use for goofing around, really.

I prefer my solution over the command-pod method though:

I do the same thing, really; I don't like using any of the big 3 for important missions, it gets a bit boring when Jeb is the first Kerbal on every celestial body in the universe, he's more of a mascot that I just use for goofing around, really.

I prefer my solution over the command-pod method though:

Hee Hee.

That made me chuckle.

You actually took the time to make a patio set!

Well after surviving the first rocket launch, the first high atmosphere and space flights, the first stable orbit... And narrowly escaping with his life during a SRB mishap that destroyed an entire craft except the command pod less han 1km off the ground... he's taking a short vacation while the rest of the kinks get worked out of this next generation of rockets.

Hee Hee.

That made me chuckle.

You actually took the time to make a patio set!

But of course! I can't have my star Kerbals cooped up in some cramped, unfashionable command pod, without a cup of coffee or reasonably-priced cornish pasty in sight, now, can I? Here at Kosta Koffee Inc, We treat our Kerbals to the good quality down-time they deserve!

...ok, yeah, that's totally going to be my theme for my .23 career. A CafÃƒÂ© on every planet! For Science! For Profit! For really wild things!

Edited December 15, 2013 by Panzerbeard
In a previous file he had just stepped out onto the surface of eve.. when Bill fell down a latter and flattened him.. unfortunate to say the least

Jeb is now back on Big K playing 9-ball after the FANTASTIC success of the first Kerbal docking in orbit. He piloted Zipper I to a rendezvous with Velcro I piloted by Bill. It wasn't too pretty, used way too much fuel, but got it in one try. I don't know about them but the Program Director is wierdly and insufferably pleased with himself.
Accidentally killed him and 2 other kerbals because I should have used unmanned for putting a rover on mun

Jebediah Kerbin is currently overseeing construction of a new station in low Kerbin orbit. However, as the project is suspended for the time being (need tweakables naow!), mission control is considering sending a capsule up to get him back to the ground.

Currently stranded I mean uh, having technical difficulties on the Mun from his engine. He is currently working on it and is en route now.

Edited December 16, 2013 by KASASpace

Jeb is outside my VAB by the Mk1 pod statue... That is where I plant a flag for every Kerbal I kill. Jeb is the care taker. When I kill a kerbal, jeb sets a flag for that Kerbal.

There are only 4 flags... Bill, Docott, Adlorf, and ... I dunno, some other one I don't remember.

Richoly Kerman's flag is on Mun, because Richoly is better and more special and because his flag is on the Mun.

And that accounts for all my dead Kerbals (in this current save game), I try hard not to kill them.
He oftenis forced to volunteers to experiment with whatever mod I happen to pick up.

My 0.22 Jeb became a bus driver on Minmus. I ended up launching a lot of missions to Minmus, as you can get there without any preparations, and the low gravity and large flat areas make it easy to land with all kinds of ridiculous things.

In 0.23, Jeb is getting bored in the command pod of a laboratory orbiting the Mun. As I haven't built a manned lander yet, he has really nothing to do.
He's on the Mun overseeing the kethane mining/converting operation...

He's in my astronaut complex, retired.

He was also my first kerbal into orbit too.

Where's Bob?

He's on the I.K.S Chiron, complaining with his crewmate that he wants to come back home.

But, where's Bill, though?

He was last seen being chased out of the astronaut complex

Edited December 18, 2013 by Sylandro

My jeb in 0.23: testing my orbital rockets

Bob: planes

Bill : deriving around on the VAB waiting for 3 man command pod to be invented

Mine is giddily sitting in the cockpit of a brand spanking new SSTO equipped with the latest RAPIER engines, wondering why he hasn't moved in the past 18 hours. Poor little guy is gonna be stuck there until tonight too.

Stranded on Eeloo along with Bill and Bob, patiently waiting for the rescue team that is currently being rescued by the rescue team [tried to dock the rescue ship with my station (while watching tv) and ended up slicing the station in two pieces]...

So not lookin' good for good ol' Jeb...
Hahahah, I've read all of these, and this one is by far the best...

Jeb is currently on R&R after a successful multi part mission on Minmus collecting science with a lander, and returning it to the orbital minmus research station, and then repeating several times until fuel had become an issue and then he returned to KSC...
stranded on Duna

I grossly overestimated a new Munlander design. Fortunately I did make it into a stable orbit before running out of fuel. Bill, Bob and Jeb are now stuck in a 16*12km retro orbit around Mun.

Bill and Bob don't look very happy but Jeb is still showing his maniacal grin.
My Jeb, along with Bill and Bob are in a low Duna orbit.
